utterances.utterance: Well, look, we're going to listen to our members on how we get this done. I'm just one of these people who believes, if we have an opportunity to change the way Washington spends and budgets in a way that works for taxpayers and solvency, let's look for those opportunities.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: do you think there will be a government shutdown?

utterances.speaker: BRADY
utterances.utterance: No, I don't. Look, we're going to pay our debts. We're going to pay them on time. We're going to create the certainty going forward. This is a healthy discussion about -- especially with $20 trillion, $21 trillion debt on the horizon, that we have this.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.utterance: Mr. Chairman, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: BRADY
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Neil.
